title: Former Tesco boss Philip Clarke 'to be quizzed by SFO'
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Aug 27, 2015, 18:30 BST - UK Markets closed Former Tesco boss Philip Clarke 'to be quizzed by SFO' By Andrew Trotman | Telegraph – 24 minutes ago 10.95 +0.28 
Philip Clarke is expected to be interviewed over Tesco (Xetra: 852647 - news ) 's £326m accounting black hole 
Former Tesco chief executive Philip Clarke (Toronto: CKI.TO - news ) is to be quizzed by the Serious Fraud Office over the retailer's massive accounting black hole . 
The 55-year-old, who left Tesco last year following a slump in sales and a profits warning, will be interviewed by prosecutors along with former commercial director Kevin Grace. 
Both would be spoken to as potential witnesses, however they will be under caution, meaning anything Mr Clarke and Mr Grace say can be used in court at a later date. 
The SFO began investigating Tesco in October, a month after Britain's largest retailer found a £326m shortfall in its profits. The issue was linked to the income Tesco makes from deals with suppliers. 
The company subsequently changed its auditor and placed nine senior staff on leave, with six stepping down. 
Mr Clarke's replacement, Dave Lewis, took over just weeks before the black hole was found. He set about shaking up the company, including how it deals with suppliers. 
Tesco has said it will try to recover Mr Clarke's £1.2m pay-off if evidence reveals that there was gross misconduct during his leadership of the supermarket. 
The group also faces a multi-billion pound legal battle with shareholders over the black hole. 
Tesco's shares rose 2.66pc to 191.55p on Thursday. They have fallen more than 6pc since the black hole was revealed. 
Tesco declined to comment on the interviews, which were first reported by Bloomberg . The SFO did not return calls for comment.
